intro: Seseli glaucescens, commonly known as blue hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and celery. The plant is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Seseli glaucescens is often found in meadows and along coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
